definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: He tried to lie away her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他极力以谎言毁损她的名誉。

sentences.english: In other words, in high myopia the eye can literally tear itself apart
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，高度近视，视力能够完全地自身毁损。

sentences.english: The gardens were destroyed by several earthquakes after the 2nd century BC.
sentences.chinese: 空中花园在公元前2世纪发生的数次地震中被毁损了。

sentences.english: And cicadas cry in fall leaves at the ruined Han palace.
sentences.chinese: 蝉在秋叶中哭泣，在毁损了的汉宫里。

sentences.english: The ship is considerably damaged in her rigging.
sentences.chinese: 这条船的帆缆受到严重毁损。

sentences.english: Conclusion Radiofrequency ablation can effectively block lumbar sympathetic ganglion.
sentences.chinese: 结论射频热凝术能有效地毁损腰交感神经节。
这个疯子毁损了艺术品。

sentences.english: Only lesion of the NAcc core, but not shell, can reduce the re-acquisition of morphine-seeking behavior.
sentences.chinese: 只有核心部毁损能够减少吗啡成痛之后的复吸行为。

definition: to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to impair/to degrade/to decrease/to reduce/to weaken/to detract from/impairment (e.g. of financial assets)
to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
